meanings.definition: The act of carrying out or putting into effect a plan, order, or course of action.
meanings.sent1: The execution of the project was flawless.
meanings.sent2: The execution of the new policy will begin next week.
meanings.sent3: The execution of the surprise party was a success.
meanings.sent4: Her execution of the dance routine was like poetry in motion.
meanings.sent5: The execution of the plan left everyone impressed.

meanings.definition: The act of putting to death as a legal penalty.
meanings.sent1: The execution of the criminal was scheduled for midnight.
meanings.sent2: The execution of the condemned prisoner sparked public debate.
meanings.sent3: The execution of the mosquito by the swatter was swift.
meanings.sent4: The storm's execution of the flowers in the garden was sudden.
meanings.sent5: The execution of justice must be carried out fairly.

meanings.definition: The act of performing or accomplishing a task or duty.
meanings.sent1: Her execution of the presentation impressed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The execution of his duties as a firefighter was commendable.
meanings.sent3: The cat's execution of catching the mouse was skillful.
meanings.sent4: The execution of the plan to rescue the hikers was successful.
meanings.sent5: The execution of the mission required precise coordination.
